com.leakyabstractions.result

Class Results

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.leakyabstractions.result.Results

  • public class Results
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that operate on or return Result instances.
    Author:
    Guillermo Calvo
    See Also:
    com.leakyabstractions.result

      • wrap

        public static <S> Result<S,java.lang.Exception> wrap(java.util.concurrent.Callable<S> callable)
        If the given callable produces a value, return a new successful result with it; otherwise returns a new failed result with the exception thrown by callable.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the success type of the result
        Parameters:
        callable - the task that produces a success value, or throws an exception if unable to do so
        Returns:
        the new result

      • wrap

        public static <S,F> Result<S,F> wrap(java.util.concurrent.Callable<S> callable,
                                     java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.Exception,F> exceptionMapper)
        If the given callable produces a value, return a new successful result with it; otherwise returns a new failed result with a value produced by the given mapping function.

        The mapping function will be applied to the exception thrown by callable to produce the possibly-null failure value.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the success type of the result
        F - the failure type of the result
        Parameters:
        callable - the task that produces a success value, or throws an exception if unable to do so
        exceptionMapper - the mapping function that produces a failure value
        Returns:
        the new result

      • combine

        public static <S,F> Result<java.util.stream.Stream<S>,java.util.stream.Stream<F>> combine(java.util.Collection<Result<S,F>> results)
        Combine a collection of results into a new one.

        If there's any failed results inside the collection, then a new failed result containing a stream of failure values will be created; otherwise a new successful result containing a stream of success values will be created.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the success type of the result
        F - the failure type of the result
        Parameters:
        results - a possibly-empty collection of results
        Returns:
        the new result

      • combine

        @SafeVarargs
public static <S,F> Result<java.util.stream.Stream<S>,java.util.stream.Stream<F>> combine(Result<? extends S,? extends F>... results)
        Combine a variable list of results into a new one.

        If there's any failed results inside the variable list, then a new failed result containing a stream of failure values will be created; otherwise a new successful result containing a stream of success values will be created.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the success type of the result
        F - the failure type of the result
        Parameters:
        results - a variable list of results
        Returns:
        the new result

      • toOptional

        public static <S> java.util.Optional<S> toOptional(Result<S,?> result)
        If the given result is successful and its success value is not null, returns an optional with it; otherwise returns an empty optional.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the optional value
        Parameters:
        result - the result to check if successful
        Returns:
        an optional containing the success value if the given result is successful and the success value is not null; otherwise an empty optional

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        result - the result to check if failed
        Returns:
        an optional containing the failure value if the given result is failed and the failure value is not null; otherwise an empty optional

      • lazy

        public static <S,F> Result<S,F> lazy(java.util.function.Supplier<Result<S,F>> supplier)
        Creates a new lazy result based on the given result supplier.

        Lazy results can be manipulated just like any other result; they will try to defer the invocation of the given supplier as long as possible. The purpose is to encapsulate an expensive operation that may be omitted if there's no actual need to examine the result.

        Lazy results can be filtered and transformed without actually performing the expensive operation:

        • filter
        • map
        • mapSuccess
        • mapFailure
        • flatMap
        • flatMapSuccess
        • flatMapFailure

        On the other hand, the supplier will be invoked if any of these terminal operations is performed on a lazy result:

        • isSuccess
        • isFailure
        • orElse
        • orElseMap
        • orElseThrow
        • orElseThrow(Function)
        • getFailureOrElseThrow

        Finally, conditional actions will be performed immediately unless they are lazy too:

        • ifSuccess
        • ifSuccessOrElse
        • ifFailure

        Once a lazy result retrieves the supplied result, all future operations will be performed immediately and the returned Result objects should not be lazy.

        The supplier is guaranteed to be invoked at most once. It must return a non-null result object; if it throws an exception or returns null then the behavior of the lazy result will be undefined.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the success type of the result
        F - the failure type of the result
        Parameters:
        supplier - the function that supplies the actual result
        Returns:
        the new lazy result
        See Also:
        lazy(Consumer)

      • lazy

        public static <T> java.util.function.Consumer<T> lazy(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
        Creates a new lazy consumer based on a regular one.

        Lazy consumers encapsulate actions that depend on success or failure and can be safely deferred or even completely ignored if a lazy result is never evaluated. They are intended to be passed as parameters to:

        • ifSuccess
        • ifSuccessOrElse
        • ifFailure

        These actions will execute immediately if passed to non-lazy results.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the input to the action
        Parameters:
        consumer - the action to be applied to this result's success value
        Returns:
        the new lazy consumer
        See Also:
        lazy(Supplier)
